title: Eineg JSON Schema
description: Serialisation verifier for reverse engineered Genie engine structures.

anyOf.description: Sound is not actually null but can be null if unused.

flag.description: If this has unknown flags, then it should be an integer.

anyOf.description: Multiple flags as literals in an array.

Tile.description: Map tile can be represented either as an array or object.

anyOf.$comment: Map tile as an array should only contain primitive types.

TileSize.description: Contains the X, Y, and Y-delta (respectively) dimensions of a tile.

pauseFrames.description: Number of frames to pause after last frame is drawn.

pauseBetweenLoops.description: Time to pause after last frame.

dropSiteMasterId.description: Object where attributes should be deposited.

stateBuild.description: Determines if a building must be constructed.

alliance.description: Differentiates between individual or global victory.

terrains.description: Passable terrains contain values that modify the behavior between units and tiles on the map.

nextObjectId.description: Should be incremented each time an object is created.

nextReusableObjectId.description: Should be incremented each time an object is created.

name.$comment: Optional: naming this helps to recognize this.

note.$comment: Optional: leaving a note helps understand this.

arguments.$comment: Beware that the list of arguments should override dynamic arguments.

anyOf.$comment: In the rare occurrence that true or false may be needed.
Rarely used other than referencing a trigger via name rather than index.

size.$comment: Optional: beware that this changes the size of the arguments list.

goal.$comment: todo: rename to aiScriptGoal or aiSignal ???

anyOf.$comment: References a trigger by its name instead of its index.
